description: Define the sequence S(a(0),a(1)) by a(n+2) is the least integer such that a(n+2)/a(n+1) > a(n+1)/a(n) for n >= 0. This is S(1,6).
comments: a(n) is the number of compositions of n when there are 6 types of ones. - _Milan Janjic_, Aug 13 2010
links: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (7,-5).
prog: (PARI) S(a0, a1, maxn) = a=vector(maxn); a[1]=a0; a[2]=a1; for(n=3, maxn, a[n]=a[n-1]^2\a[n-2]+1); aS(1, 6, 40) \\ _Colin Barker_, Feb 16 2016
